description:
But first, Barack Obama and Benjamin Netanyahu have never got on particularly well, but their relationship appears to have hit a new low. The row centres around an invitation for the Israeli leader to address the US Congress next week. It was made by the Republican Speaker John Boehner without consulting the White House. Earlier this week, the US National Security adviser Susan Rice said Mr Netanyahu's decision to deliver the speech in Washington just two weeks before Israeli elections was destructive to US-Israeli relations. On Wednesday, the Israeli prime minister hit back, accusing America and other world powers of abandoning a pledge to stop Iran getting a nuclear bomb.

"There are a lot of reasons to worry about the agreement that is being formulated right now. The world powers have undertaken to prevent Iran from obtaining nuclear weapons. It appears they have given up on this commitment. I am not ready to accept it. As Israel's prime minister, I'm responsible for the security of Israel and the Israeli citizens. And I must do everything I can to warn of the danger if Iran obtains nuclear weapons, not only for us and to our neighbours, also to the whole world."
